alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 23 at 9:37AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Tusayan area in Coconino County. * WHEN...Until 200 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 933 AM MST, emergency management reported flooding in Tusayan. - Tusayan is the most likely place to experience flooding. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Coconino Wash, Bright Angel Wash, Pipe Creek, Little Red Horse Wash, Cottonwood Creek, Grapevine Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tusayan, Pipe Creek Vista, Grand Canyon - South Rim, and Ten-x Campground. - This includes State Route 64 between mile markers 227 and 237. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks has occurred, dirt roads are muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses have been flooded.
